summary: "The Place Beyond the Pines" is a 2012 American crime drama film directed by Derek Cianfrance. It tells three connected stories: a motorcycle stunt rider turned criminal (Ryan Gosling), a corrupt policeman (Bradley Cooper), and two teenagers affected by their actions 15 years later. The film explores themes of fathers and sons, masculinity, and legacy. Shot in Schenectady, New York, it premiered at the 2012 Toronto International Film Festival and received positive reviews, grossing $47 million worldwide.
title: The Place Beyond the Pines
